EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the factory interface that processes copper‐plates into copper cables:
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) [Direction: RIGHT]
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) [Direction: UP]
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) [Direction: DOWN]
• Assembling Machine‑1 at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
• Transport Belt at Position(x=0.5, y=17.5) [Direction: UP]

This structure is meant to receive copper‐plates (via its inserters and chest) and produce copper cables through assembly.

─────────────────────
### Belt Depot Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the dedicated depot for receiving items from the extraction system:
• Wooden Chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Adjacent Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) [Direction: UP]

This depot is used as an isolated drop‐off point for items before they are routed further in the system.

─────────────────────
### Unconnected Belt Target at Position(x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at Position(x=-4.5, y=18.5)

It was intended to serve as a target for a multi‑segment belt connection from the extraction system but remains isolated due to connection errors.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors (Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217)
– When attempting to connect transport belts, the target was misinterpreted as a steam engine. Always ensure that belts are linked to an inserter (or another valid item‑receiving entity) rather than directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.

• Placement Distance Error (Step 212)
– The placement of a wooden chest failed because the target position was too far from the player. Move closer to the desired target so that placement occurs within the maximum allowed distance.

• Inventory Availability Error (Step 213)
– An attempt to place a wooden chest failed due to its absence in the inventory. Verify that the necessary entity is available in inventory before attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Error (Step 212)
– A NameError occurred because ‘target_chest’ was not defined. Ensure that all variables are properly defined and referenced to prevent such errors.
